website_summaries.verdict: Fit for feline royalty, this premium cat bed consists of a medical-grade orthopedic foam base encased in a plush cover for superb sleeping comfort. Exceptional support for aging or ailing cats.
pros: Thick orthopedic foam base reduces pressure on achy joints
Bolsters add a sense of security and make a great back or headrest
Upholstery-grade velvet bolster cover and microfleece base cover provide comfort and warmth
cons: Kneaders and scratchers might poke holes into the cover

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.text: My 12.5 year old Pomeranian loves her new bed! I was afraid that the medium would be too big. I'm glad I went with this size. She loves to stretch out - but still has the option to snuggle up into the bolster. For anyone needing a size reference, she weighs 11 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Love

customer_reviews.title: So far... Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: as soon as I unpacked it and set it down, both of my dogs laid down on it and my smallest hasn't gotten up yet :) my other one is kind of upset that the little one is on it haha hopefully it stays intact as I have frequently woken up to stuffing everywhere from the other beds we've tried! I'll update my review if anything changes!!
customer_reviews.author: Maritza

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Got this bed 20min ago, the picture speaks for itself
customer_reviews.author: Connor & Sandra

customer_reviews.title: but I'm a little disappointed that the bed is already looking really worn - ...
customer_reviews.text: Update: It's been 2 weeks since my dog got her new bed, which she LOVES, but I'm a little disappointed that the bed is already looking really worn - after only 2 weeks. The soft cloth over the egg crate is really thin and stretched out and the color doesn't look good anymore. I have a 45 lb Vizsla mix and she LOVES her new bed! Perfect size for her to spread out or curl up. It's super soft and seems durable, and the grip on the bottom keeps it from sliding around on my hardwood floors.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: The foam in the bed is light weight
customer_reviews.text: The description reads "Plush medical grade orthopedic foam" which I took to mean firm and supportive. I have a 9 pound dog and after about a month the foam is about half compressed. Take it as you like as to whether I had the wrong expectation (I was thinking more of a memory foam) or whether you agree the description lead me in that direction. The bolster is firm and my dog likes to curl up in the bed. The zippers are good quality and I took off out the foam and fill from the bed to see how easy it would be to put it back after washing. Taking it out and putting it back was effortless.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Super Thin Bed
customer_reviews.text: When other reviews say the material is thin, that is an understatement. It appears they did add stuffing material to the bolsters which was very firm and that outside material is heavy and nice! But the part where the dog actually lays their body is paper-thin! If my Chihuahua or Dachshund try to take it over from my mild mannered lab or beagle, they will destroy in a short time. Right now it is ok, but if you have a dog that kneads the bed or scratches it before they lay down, this definitely will not last. Super thin.
customer_reviews.author: Birdie

customer_reviews.title: Nice Cushioned Bed, Not For Chewers
customer_reviews.text: Dogs seemed to like this bed. One sleeps in it nightly. From comfort, style perspective it's a home run. The drawback is the fabric durability. One of the dogs decided to chew a hole in it, less than 24 hours, a good sized hole and lots of little foam bits - foam is solid but dog took great joy in pulling out pieces. So if your dog is a chewer, look for another product, like the cozy cave style beds. There's a reason they are twice the price. They are more durable. The dog I purchased the bed for (not the chewer) seems to like the bed, he puts his back against the bolster and curls up. Nice cushion.
customer_reviews.author: CatSttl

customer_reviews.title: This is a great bed for my older fox terrier with arthritis
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bed for my older fox terrier with arthritis, and definitely a better price than some of the other options I was looking at! It doesn't squish in to the ground when you push on the base of the bed (it's relatively thick) and the bolsters are a pleasant padding firmness. Before ordering, I had some trouble visualizing the dimensions so I'm posting a picture with him sleeping in it. Sorry for the blankies... He is a somewhat long terrier weighing in at 20lbs. It is long enough for him to lay lengthwise with his head on one pillow bolster.
customer_reviews.author: EmilyHW

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my
customer_reviews.text: This review is for the small bed. It’s perfect for my 9 lb French bulldog puppy. She immediately crawled in it and went to sleep. She has plenty of room but I’m sure she’ll be too big soon enough. It’s surprising thick and plush and the bolster is perfect for her to rest her head. The zippers looked like nice strong zippers that I could easily get the cover on and off without worrying about them breaking. I would highly recommend if you have a small dog/puppy. I would say 12 lbs or less.
customer_reviews.author: Vana

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I have a bullmastiff and a German shepherd. They love this bed! It's very comfy and the darker brown ring makes for a nice pillow. My mastiff spends about 18 hours a day in this bed. We've had this bed for 4 months now and there are no signs of wear and tear.
customer_reviews.author: Cdoolady

customer_reviews.title: Will buy again!
customer_reviews.text: We bought a medium for our new boxer baby back in November 2016. This bed has been great! Now that he's 6 months & about 40 lbs., all long legs, and big head/chest its almost time for the large size. The actual foam bedding is holding up great, the cover gets washed once/week and still flawless. The inside mesh bolster can unzip and be washed also but we've yet to need to. My only minor lil "ehh" is it seems to be prone to static, even with fabric softener. You can hear and see (when the lights are off) the little static bolts.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: It fits her just right although a tiny bit big and she likes it just fine.
customer_reviews.text: Be fore warned that this bed is an odd shape. Because it is a half circle, it makes it bigger then normal. I ordered a Medium first for a 50-lb Husky because she sleeps curled in a ball. She could hardly sit in it. Then I ordered the Large. It fits her just right although a tiny bit big and she likes it just fine.
customer_reviews.author: RebeccaMidC

customer_reviews.title: So cozy, medium is great
customer_reviews.text: Just arrived and my Bella hasn’t left her cozy bed. Took picture of her old bed beside it and she totally lost interest. Liked it so much, I just purchased a smaller one for my Yorkie. Update: purchased smaller one. If only the size was a little bigger. There’s too much of a difference in size. My Yorkie seems to like, hope she continues to do so.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Small and medium sized
customer_reviews.text: I bought a small grey and medium for two dogs. The small grey is for my 6 lbs maltipoo that has long legs. You can see that she is curled up comfortably in the small size.. The 6lb maltipoo originally liked the medium sized but I was able to get her to like the small bed. I’m still trying to get our 18 lbs Brittany spaniel poodle to take to the bed but she would rather lay on the floor. It’s a great bed love the bolster and seems to be holding up after a week with the little one that digs around before settling in. I will update as time passes.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: My dogs wouldn't even get in the beds
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea why but neither of my dogs would even get near the beds. I even washed them in the soap I wash everything in and I set the insides outside in the sun and fresh air. Still wouldn't get near the bed. I set them in the beds and they would jump out before their feet barely hit the bed. I'm at a loss. They were not cheep and I am beyond the return deadline. Now I have two dog beds that are worthless. I purchased two other beds (from a different seller) and the dogs are fine with the new ones. It is really a shame because they are really cute looking beds.
customer_reviews.author: Noel

customer_reviews.title: EGG CRATE ON BOTTOM...🐶😤
customer_reviews.text: I’m going to try and post picture. I have no clue how people can say this is a good bed, unless they received a different bed than I did. I’m telling you how they can claim it to be ortho bed is false. It is nothing but the ...EGG CRATE...material. I have a dog that absolutely requires orthopedic beds. There is no way she can sleep on this. The cover is good . The bottom is nothing but.. Like I said ...EGG CRATE... So guess it’s up to the buyer. They have better beds at Pets Mart for $15.00. 🥺🐶. VERY, VERY DISAPPOINTED ☹️
customer_reviews.author: Nykie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for older dogs
customer_reviews.text: I love this dog bed. It has been wonderful for my 16-year-old teacup poodle. I got her the small and she fits in perfectly. She is only 4 pounds so if your dog is over five pounds I would suggest the medium size. My poodle loves the bed. She cuddles against the side. I love how easy the bed is to wash. There is a zipper for the top and bottom. I would suggest getting a waterproof protector to put over the memory foam and under the cover. I found this out the hard way after an accident.
customer_reviews.author: lauren patterson

customer_reviews.title: Bed lasted 3.5+ years and still going strong
customer_reviews.text: We originally bought this bed in late 2016 for our ~50lb lab mix. She loves it and spends a lot of time lounging with her chin propped up on the bolster. We love that you can easily unzip and wash the cover. The bolster pillow comes out and we've replaced the bottom cushion (originally egg crate style foam) a few times with replacement foam from Hobby Lobby. We have since moved to a larger house and decided to buy a second new dog bed for her. The old one is still going strong in the other room! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sally

customer_reviews.title: My dog tore it up
customer_reviews.text: The outer part of the dog bed is great - however, the middle section was destroyed by my dog in one day. The fabric in the center is very thin, the inside cushion is made of "egg carton" type foam. My dog likes to do a little light scratching before he circles to go to bed - he scratched straight through the thin fabric and then tore in the flimsy egg carton foam. We've had dog beds, and he's never been able to scratch through the material/nor the foam.
customer_reviews.author: S. Crandall

customer_reviews.title: A little big but good
customer_reviews.text: My dog did not like it at first because he is used to climbing over something to get in bed and thought the back was the front. lol Now he loves just walking into it. He had one eye taken out for glaucoma and the other is blind and he is 13 years old. This bed is just perfect for him. But you don't' need to be disabled to use it. I would have preferred to be just a bit smaller in width as he is a small dog but it works and that is the true importance for buying it.
customer_reviews.author: jo

customer_reviews.title: Not Good in Larger Sizes
customer_reviews.text: Okay K&H, what did you do differently in the manufacturing of these wonderful beds? Ordered the next side up for my growing puppy and he had it torn apart in 10 minutes. The bottom material was extremely lose so it didn't take him long to make a little hole and then rip out the foam. The bed was floppy so it didn't have the same firmness. The sides didn't have the same amount of firm stuffing. Really! If you are going to modify these beds as they get larger in size it should be stated in the listing. Next time I'll buy a cheap bed because that's all this was. Not worth the money! Very Disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: ARIZONA ROSE 🌹Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: 6lb Chihuahua, best bed we've ever had
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best bed I have ever purchased for my chihuahua. Minka is 6lbs and a long hair chihuahua and she stretches out nicely in it. She loves to lean up against the bolster feature and spread out. She also takes her treats into the bed to eat them! I have yet to wash this bed, it does pick up fur, so i take a lint roller to it, and I purchased it a couple of months ago. Check out the vid to get a better idea of the materials.
customer_reviews.author: foxcroft

customer_reviews.title: Washable and the dogs love them
customer_reviews.text: Once I got the hang of how to re-insert the bottom cushion and the bolster cushion after washing it was easy. We have several sizes for different dogs and all are popular. The only downside was something the maker could not control; we got two new beagle puppies and they love to rip the stuffing out of them, along with everything else. Highly recommend the beds.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Turner

customer_reviews.title: OUR LAB LOVES IT!!!
customer_reviews.text: Just arrived today but it's already a hit with our old girl! I read every review to determine which size to get for our 90lb lab - glad I went with the Large, she has plenty of room and yet it snuggles her perfectly as well. She's never had a bed before but she's fast asleep in it now!
customer_reviews.author: Aura L. Hoffmann

customer_reviews.title: Made well and comfy-- a must for aging pets
customer_reviews.text: I got this for our aging chihuahua who is suffering from arthritis and she seems to really like it. It has plenty of space when she wants to stretch out but also a nice pillowed side for her to prop her head on and look out the window. The cushion inside is thick and the zippered back is nice, so we could easily wash it or even add more cushion if needed down the road. I had looked at many so called cushioned beds for her before and the cushion was something that seemed not thick enough. This is 3 inches deep. I was wary of ordering one that I could not feel of first but I was not disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: KimberlyK

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: I have a 6.5 lb 13 year old Yorkie with typical issues of an aging dog. I couldn't wait to get this bed for her. It should be advertised as an non-small bed. She won't have anything to do with it and I threw her other bed away. :-(
customer_reviews.author: Little Peach

customer_reviews.title: Our dog loves this bed! He is 2, ...
customer_reviews.text: Our dog loves this bed! He is 2, we waited a while to get a "big boy" bed because he would keep chewing and destroying anything soft! He does really well with this resting in the evening. We got this specifically for the bolster and that it is washable. He even sometimes prefers this to sleeping in our bed. He is almost 60 lbs, a retriever mix. We ordered a LG, he has plenty of room. Could have went with a medium if all he did was curl up, but he likes to spread out. If you have a dog that stretches out and you are on the fence, definitely go with the larger size.
customer_reviews.author: KM

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd K&H bed I've purchased. The first 2 were the big puffy kind, which were great by the way! We have a senior dog that seemed to be having a little trouble getting out of the puffy bed though, so I thought I'd try a "flat" bed. We've had it for over a month now and both dogs like it. I got a medium and we have 2 Miniature Schnauzers. It's a good size for them. The small probably would have been alright but they can stretch out a little in this one.
customer_reviews.author: C. Woltjer

customer_reviews.title: Quality doesn't match the price
customer_reviews.text: Bummed about the quality for the price. We took the cover off to wash it and the zipper split when we tried to zip it back up (1st wash, less than a week of owning the bed.) The foam deteriorated from our dog pressing on the outside of it (as dogs do when they are "making their bed") I totally get that it wouldn't hold up from the dog digging at it but knowing it's for a dog, wish the foam was stronger or a different material that would hold up for more than a week!)
customer_reviews.author: Sage

customer_reviews.title: Great buy! I bought the XL for my 70lb ...
customer_reviews.text: Great buy! I bought the XL for my 70lb Bully, and the thing is huge. It's big enough for my 120lb Rottweiler as well. They could probably both curl up in it if they were open to sharing, but they're not. In hind sight I should have gone a size smaller for her, but I have no complaints. She loves it and its comfy.
customer_reviews.author: WendyO

customer_reviews.title: This is not memory foam
customer_reviews.text: This is just egg carton foam, which I already know that my pets have no use for. Therefore, I ordered memory foam to cut to size, and hoping for the best when it gets here. If I had known how cheap the foam was, I would have order the more expensive memory foam bed and saved money.
customer_reviews.author: L. Abraham

customer_reviews.title: This bed is amazing.
customer_reviews.text: Day 1. I eye this new bit of furniture with a wary eye. My humans make noises and weird games tempting my exploration. Day 2. Finally after much cajoling, and no small measure of treats, I will award them with my reluctant attendance. Day 3. I have found the throne for my new reign.
customer_reviews.author: Eleuthera

customer_reviews.title: Zakk approved - from delivery to snoring in 5 minutes
customer_reviews.text: My dog is so happy with his new bed. He's a 60 pound pitty mix and it fits him perfectly. (I got size Medium) He sleeps curled up and the bed cradles him perfectly. If you have a dog his size who likes to stretch out I would recommend a size larger.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Moore

customer_reviews.title: Dog bed comfort.
customer_reviews.text: The dogs love it. The wrap around design helps them feel safe and secure. I have had this now for a year and it it has held of well. Washes easily and does not hold the dog smell from dirt and hair. A year later and the cushion still provides a soft laying area and the border has not weakened. This is a well made product. I would recommend this to anybody with a larger dog, two of mine are 50 and 60 lbs.and they have plenty of room.I have a Westie also and he loves it too.
customer_reviews.author: DisneyDave

customer_reviews.title: Useable and durable
customer_reviews.text: The gray one in the photo has been in use for 4 years. It has been peed on (marked) by visiting dogs quite a few times and has been in the washing machine at least 8 times. The brown one was purchased last week. My point being that the gray one doesn't look a whole lot different than the brown one. These things hold up well with use and my doggies love them.
customer_reviews.author: T. Dorman

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves it, but poor cushion quality
customer_reviews.text: My dog curled up in this instantly upon its arrival and seems to love the very thick, curved cushioned sides for support. Great design. However, a month or so later, when I took the cover off for the first time to wash it, I noticed the orthopedic (foam egg-crate) cushion was already substantially compressed and almost non-existent in the center. Disappointing! I will have to add more cushioning there. She sometimes claws at it, in a futile attempt to fluff it up in the center. My dog is definitely not too heavy (50lbs) for this size L bed, so it is not a size problem.
customer_reviews.author: C. Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Beware of size
customer_reviews.text: Just got the bed today and it's a lot smaller than I thought. I ordered the small because my Pug is only 12 lbs. The actual bed itself is very good quality and well made. I would recommend buying it just be aware of the size you are getting.
customer_reviews.author: Tea S.

customer_reviews.title: Too Bumpy
customer_reviews.text: Just opened this up. The entire product would be awesome if the foam wasn't so "egg crate'ish". Its REALLY bumpy. Would be perfect with an overlay of foam over it to mask that feel and provide additional support. I wouldn't want to sleep on it so neither would Boxer Princess. Going straight back. Bummer!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: It took me a long time to decide on a pet bed for my aging pooch. After reading what seemed like hundreds of reviews, I decided on the large size of this bed. (I have a medium-sized, 50-pound dog). The size of this bed is perfect for her, although I probably could have gotten away with the next smaller size, but with the large she has room to stretch out. She was comfortable in this bed right away, and has officially made it "her spot". Would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Jmf

customer_reviews.title: One for Each Dog!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs have a wide variety of dog beds randomly throughout the house. Originally I only bought one of these for my older westie to sleep in at night, but I noticed our younger westie would sneak off in the middle of the day to lay in it. I had to buy a second one so they could both use their favorite bed at the same time. It does seem cozy!
customer_reviews.author: luciddreamz

customer_reviews.title: Amazon failed here
customer_reviews.text: Not as described. Returned both beds, with separate slips, etc but only received a refund for ONE. I am very dissatisfied with Amazon right now. These aren't cheap beds and I am not made of money!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves this bed
customer_reviews.text: My 13 lb. Bichon Frise loves this bed. It's not actually long enough for him to completely stretch out ("frog-style") as he likes to do sometimes but for a curl-up, cozy nap, he loves it. Nice non-slip grip keeps it still on our hardwood floors and provides nice insulation. The fabric is very cozy and the middle has an egg-crate-like under layer that he seems to love and provides good support for his joints. Great product. He usually sleeps on the bed at night but during the day this was a great solution now that he is too old and stiff to jump up on the couch during the day.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Amazing pet bed. 100% recommended!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing bed for senior pups!!! I have a 15 year old Pomeranian Shih Tzu mix and he has some pretty serious back problems that keep him from being able to jump up on the bed or couch to rest so I got this bed in hopes he would quit laying straight on the hard floors. He loves it and seems so incredibly comfortable on it... There's enough padding that he can get in and out of it easily and seems to be so comfortable resting on it. I'll be ordering another one of these for him!! I'm so happy with this purchase!!!!
customer_reviews.author: britbrat

customer_reviews.title: It has the Charlie stamp of approval
customer_reviews.text: I think the photo speaks for itself he hasn't moved off of it since I took it out of the box! Much better than his old one and less expensive! Thrilled with the purchase! He is a 15lb Dachshund and I bought the medium and it's perfect!!!
customer_reviews.author: SloaneZ

customer_reviews.title: Best dog bed for easy cleaning and dog approved
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased three of these beds in large and two in extra large. My dogs love them, they use the elevated part for a head rest and sleep all day in those beds. If the odd "accident" occurs on them, they are easy to take apart quickly for washing. I haven't had too much trouble putting them back together either. I have purchased so many dog beds in the past that are impossible to get back together so when I got my first, about 2 years ago, this was a miracle. I know I will be purchasing another to replace one of the more expensive beds the dogs don't use.
customer_reviews.author: Kristan

customer_reviews.title: My Dog LOVES IT!
customer_reviews.text: This bed was worth every penny. The coushion has stayed flyyfy and the sides and back have held up well. The material is very well made and stitching is quality. I like how you can unzip th bottom as well as the side and wash the material. I always put a garbage bag inside for added protection around the cushion. My dog didn't seem to mind at all! I recommend this to ANY dog owner, not on only for the old ailing pets- like my Jake! Well done!! My 15yr old loves it- he doesn't have much time left but this was so worth it for him!!!!
customer_reviews.author: I Buy Too Much

customer_reviews.title: it looks good but when you look closer it really isn't all ...
customer_reviews.text: for the money, no. the medium was too small for my 25 pound Kesshond. it looks good but when you look closer it really isn't all that great. it is okay. I returned this. I got the Petco Oval Tan and Cream Lounger Dog Bed. that is an amazing bed, every inch of it. it is sturdy where it needs to be and the pillow is amazing and the material is even more amazing. Listen, I liked it so much I put this review on for this bed and spent all the rest of the time talking about the Petco bed. The large is great. I think on sale directly from Petco, but you can get it thru Amazon too.
customer_reviews.author: AT

customer_reviews.title: Laying sprawled or curled up type dog.
customer_reviews.text: Pros-Made well Cons-Medium was too large for my Shih Tzu to curl in unless she wanted to lay spread out. She is 13 lbs. If your dog likes to only curl up to keep warm, you can order a smaller one for a 13 lb dog. The sides are very high in the Medium bed. Don't think she can lean on them because her neck is too short.
customer_reviews.author: Babag

customer_reviews.title: Dogs were able to make several holes in the center ...
customer_reviews.text: Dogs were able to make several holes in the center within a month. Not very durable if you have dogs that scratch/ dig in their beds.
customer_reviews.author: Tamara Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Boxer loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Our 65 pound Boxer LOVES this bed! It's just the right size, and the bolstered sides are perfect for him to rest his head. The cover is removable which is great for washing. It's a nice suede/microfiber fabric on the bolstering, and a soft minke type fabric on the bed. My only complaint about this bed is the price seems a bit high. Other than that it's a great bed.
customer_reviews.author: K.I.

customer_reviews.title: My Basset Loves it
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the medium and Blue loves it The bolster is perfect for him. the cover zips off for easy washing
customer_reviews.author: Brady E Inches

customer_reviews.title: Nice zippers. The medium looked too small for my ...
customer_reviews.text: Well made. Nice zippers. The medium looked too small for my 62lb Lab. But she loves it. But I bought a large and both my dogs 62 plus 58 lb would fit in. 10" longer
customer_reviews.author: Vv

customer_reviews.title: This is a great bed. I've had it for several months now
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bed. I've had it for several months now, and it's holding up extremely well. I have a 40lb dog and a 10lb dog who share it. The bumper is keeping it's shape, the cover is easy to remove and wash. The bumper is in a separate zipper than the bedding, which makes it MUCH EASIER to put back together after a wash. The integrated ones always look mishappen when reassembled. I will say the beds are LARGE! I probably should have ordered the large, not the XL, but my dogs seem to like the extra room. Just a heads up though, these are big beds!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: My Shih tau seems to like napping inside this.
customer_reviews.text: My dog is 13, and I wanted a soft surround for her to rest in. Her bed fits inside, and she sleeps for hours in this. It is so easy to set up, and love that it's easy to move. Also love that bottom and top are removable in case I want to contain her outside.
customer_reviews.author: BirdLdy, AZ

customer_reviews.title: Repeat buyer - love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this bed. It can be unzipped and washed. Nice structured side so she often lays her head on it like a pillow or lookout and she also likes curling up inside completely. The bottomit really soft egg crate foam, etc. make sure to get the size that suits your dogs sleeping and/or resting behavior depending on the use. I and a repeat Buyer of this, she finally wore out the first one after years and many washes.
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl Daymon

customer_reviews.title: Paw-fect
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the medium size for my 10 pound Maltese and it's perfect size. He recently had hip surgery and has arthritis and he loves the bed.
customer_reviews.author: pookster

customer_reviews.title: Great, sturdy (yet soft!) dog bed.
customer_reviews.text: I'm impressed with this bed. The fabric is very soft while also being very sturdy. The surface underneath the bed part is egg crate - so it's not a totally smooth surface. I was not aware of that when I purchased it, but it's great nonetheless. My dog sleeps in our bed every night and the first night we had this bed he was in it instead - by choice! It seems like it's going to hold up well, but we did just get it a few days ago. I'll keep you posted!
customer_reviews.author: Kitchen Witch

customer_reviews.title: My cat took a while to warm up to this but now loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought those for my cat a while back and she spent most of her time walking around this on my couch not sleeping in it she would lay up against it but not in it. Recently after placing her in the bed one night she goes in there and lays down every single night it fits her perfectly I got the small one for a 9 pound cat. The construction is very nice I give it an A +
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Good at first, but didn't last as long as I expected.
customer_reviews.text: For the amount of money spent on this dog bed, I expected it to last longer than it did (I got about 18 months out of it). About 12 months in the liner ripped, and by the end of its days, the cheap egg crate foam had disintegrated, and the remains were flattened to the point that my dog was basically lying on the hard floor below. Won't be buying this type of bed again and will be looking for a memory foam alternative.
customer_reviews.author: dom2114

customer_reviews.title: The BEST
customer_reviews.text: Now that time has passed, I have seen my senior pet fall in LOVE with this bed. I find that she is very relaxed, comfortable, and sleeps sounder. It was very important to me to find the perfect bed for my dog due to her joint pain. She loves her bed and I could not be more content with my purchase :)
customer_reviews.author: TMR

customer_reviews.title: Great Bed-Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I have seen these beds at double the price and this one is excellent. The minute I took it out of the (very large!) box it arrived in, my dog curled up and took a nap. He seems much happier in this bed than his previous which was an open rectangle design with faux sheep skin cover. The cover became so dirtry over time that it looks dingy after washing. This new one's microfiber fabric looks like it will clean very easily. Given that it's gray, it does not show the dirt quickly. The color is a true gray. Some others have commented their computers showed it more towards a blue.
customer_reviews.author: CyndyC

customer_reviews.title: my dog loves it
customer_reviews.text: this is the third time i purchased this item for my dog in almost 8 years. my dog loves it even better than the bed. i bring it with me when i want him to relax and it is comfort to him. easy to wash
customer_reviews.author: Minnie

customer_reviews.title: Size
customer_reviews.text: Received my item fast, very nice product I really like it. But I bought the small for my little Yorkie and she doesn't like it 'cause it's too small for her. I should have got the medium. Was going to send it back for the next size, but my man tossed the bag it came in, in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: addiegirl

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars from the pickiest of diva dogs
customer_reviews.text: My dog is very anti anything-made-for-dogs so I wasn't sure he'd go for this, but he actually loves it! I was so pleasantly surprised. He's been sleeping in it every night (he used to sleep on a combination of our most expensive down pillows and fur blankets, sigh) and even goes to it for naps during the day. He likes to have his back against something when he sleeps so the bolstered edges are great and the foam is super comfy.
customer_reviews.author: LES1209

customer_reviews.title: Great bed!
customer_reviews.text: Little late writing this review, bought this a while ago. It’s held up well & my dog loves it. It is a little firm, I put his fluffy blanket in to make it more plush. The cover is easily removable to be washed .
customer_reviews.author: Tan

customer_reviews.title: So comfortable and cute
customer_reviews.text: All three of my cats love this bed. The foam on the inside has little ridges and just seems so comfy. They really seem to love the shape of the bed and curling up in it.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Jones

customer_reviews.title: Pets won’t sleep in them
customer_reviews.text: Good concept but poor execution. Neither the dog nor the cat will sleep in their new beds - even with extra blankets piled in them. The beds are stiff and have an uncomfortable bottom layer that feels like egg crates. I bought these for the removable covers but if the critters won’t sleep in them, it doesn’t matter.
customer_reviews.author: MonicaO

customer_reviews.title: Seems well made and comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Seems well made and comfy! I can’t speak to the ease of cleaning/removing the cover yet but the zippers to remove the cover are sturdy and unzip with ease. I got the medium sized bed for my 13 year old cat with arthritis, and is plenty big enough with room for her to spread out. I have a blanket over it to keep it cleaner longer. She looks so comfy and loves her new bed! I’m happy I got this one.
customer_reviews.author: Gina B.

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality, medium fits shih tzu or lhasa, cover washed well
customer_reviews.text: Dogs love them. We ordered a medium for our 15 pound Shih Tzu (the dog on the left in the brown bed) and another medium for our 20 pound Lhasa (gray bed in right of pic). There is some excess room but I think the small would have been too small. Occasionally they both squeeze into one bed together, but that is an extremely tight fit. The covers have washed well in the "handwash" setting of my washing machine.
customer_reviews.author: Betty Boop

customer_reviews.title: Fabric on top fell apart
customer_reviews.text: Changing my review from 5 stars (when it was new) to 2 stars (6 months later). Even when keeping this covered with a blanket, the flimsy fabric on the top of the dog bed is coming apart so much that I have to throw it away. I had hoped it would last longer.
customer_reviews.author: C. Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: High recommendation
customer_reviews.text: This is my second dog bed purchase. I was sooo happy w the first one. It is well made. Lots of support for my little 5 lbs dog who like to snuggle in bed. Looks nice and product has two zippers for different portions of the bed. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Redwood

customer_reviews.title: My dog's favorite new bed!
customer_reviews.text: My dog was recently diagnosed with arthritis in her hips so I've started the process of replacing all her regular beds with orthopedic beds to give her extra support. She LOVES this bed. I have a very small German Shepherd who is about the size of a border collie. I bought the large bed and it fits her perfectly. She loves to rest her head on the roll around this bed and just looks very cozy in it. This has quickly become her favorite bed in the house. I'll be ordering more.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love this bed
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love this bed! Originally I only purchased one because of the price--I wanted to make sure my dog(s) would even use it. One prefers to lay on the floor and one prefers to lay on a down pillow on my bed. Immediately, my little princess went right to the bed (she was the one I had originally purchased it for) like she knew it was hers and within two weeks I knew I needed to buy another one. The spoiled one would sit by the bed and whine until the second one got out. I bought two. They both love their beds.
customer_reviews.author: indygirl

customer_reviews.title: Well made doggie bed.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my shih tzu, but it's hard to keep the lab out of it! It's well made and holds up to the lab's lounging and the shih tzu's "digging" to make it feel comfy. SO . . . I bought a bigger one for the lab, and it's a hugely favorite bed!!! These beds are comfortable, and best of all, completely washable!! Yep, these are the best on the market I think! I have 3 small dogs and 2 labs, I may have to keep buying more of these!
customer_reviews.author: PosTx

customer_reviews.title: Stiff and bulky
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure it's a great bed but my dog doesn't use it! High quality, bulky, a little stiff at first. I got a medium for my 6.8 lb pomeranian who likes to spread out when sleeping and I think it's a good size. I made the mistake thinking he'd like a stiffer bed since he's a Pomeranian and they get hot, but I guess he's a pillow-type.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Great dog bed!
customer_reviews.text: We have bought two of these beds for our Weimaraner and she really loves them. She is crate trained and she likes to lay in the one in the living room so much, we bought one and put it in her crate and she really loves that. It allows her to curl up and gives her that den feeling that dog packs are naturally instinctive to. We did try out the largest bed, but that is LARGE and was too big for her. Maggie weighs about 70 lbs. Easily two of her could have fit in the biggest bed.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Y.

customer_reviews.title: I like how the zippers and seams are on the outside ...
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this product! I like how the zippers and seams are on the outside of the bed. My dog loves to dig at his bed and chew at the zippers if they are easily reachable but this one is great. Holds up super strong and it is very comfy. I know cause sometimes I rest my head on it when i lay with my dog. Definitely recommend this bed, great value!
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: This is great bed. My dog is medium size German Shepherd ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow its Big. This is great bed.My dog is medium size German Shepherd (72 pounds). Never had a bed before,she used my Dads chair in the livingroom. we recently moved so Dads old chair went,replaced with a lift chair recliner. that we do not want the dog climbing on,so we got this. well as soon as i put it down she went and sniffed it for a min then proceeded to plop her self down in it and fall asleep. havent tried to wash it yet as only had a few days but looks easy enough to remove the cover.
customer_reviews.author: keldog5675

customer_reviews.title: Large is too small for a 50# dog
customer_reviews.text: I just recieved bed yesterday. I like the structure and seems durable. I am disappointed in the reviews I read...i reads pages worth too. From the reviews I determined my 50# boxer woukd need the large bed. The lg is too small...unless she never wants to stretch out and stay curled uo all the time. I will return it and get the XL. I gave it a 5 star because description is accurate, picture is accurate, and my dog didn't sink to the floor, the padding cushioned her.
customer_reviews.author: djf

customer_reviews.title: Bigger is not always better.
customer_reviews.text: I would not buy it again. The bed is huge but the foam is just one layer of egg shell on the bottom. No support at all. For this much money I should not have to buy additional foam for this. Secondly, and I do not know if it is just my dog but the egg shell foam has dimples in it and when my dog feels those dimples he immediately starts scratching and biting at the cover. I had to take the foam out and turn it over.
customer_reviews.author: Otto56

customer_reviews.title: Dogs are family so they must be comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This is the fourth one of these beds I've purchased, and we love all four. This one was going in my daughter's aparment so there is not a ton of space for the bed. That is why I originally ordered the medium for her 45lb lab mix, and I was shocked at how small it was! We returned the medium, moved her furniture around and ordered the large. All the dogs LOVE these beds. They are very comfortable, and the "pillow" is one of their favorite parts.
customer_reviews.author: Christina M. Slaven

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, but will have to eventually throw away
customer_reviews.text: My dog likes it and is comfortable but its not water proof so if he pees on it it will soak to the foam underneath which you can't wash. Eventually i'll have to throw it out. Also, the foam could be better quality. If they could fix both that it would be pretty good and would buy again. For a cheap bed it's not bad
customer_reviews.author: Christopher H. Vu

customer_reviews.title: Great luxury bed
customer_reviews.text: Bought the medium for my 15 lb Dachshund that just had back surgery. He must stay crated 4 to 6 weeks.It is a very nice bed. My dachshund will occasionally dig into his bed but not very much so not sure about that kind of durability. It looks pretty durable yet cozy and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Anne MarieTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Good size for 60 pound dog, nice bed
customer_reviews.text: I got the large size for my 60 pound lab mix. The size is decent for him. If I had room for the extra-large and wanted to spend the money, I would probably choose the extra large size but he can lay down just fine and stretch out most of the way if he wants. The bed is attractive and has a lot of cushion. The dog it is meant for is 11 years old and he really does appreciate more support and cushion when he sleeps. He layed down in this bed immediately and looked quite cozy. I am sure he'll get a lot of use out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Kendalyn Thuma

customer_reviews.title: Great bed,  easy to wash
customer_reviews.text: I love this bed because the bolster section and the mattress section come out of the cover easily for washing. I have washed it once so far, and it is was easy to take apart, wash, and put back together again; it cleaned up nicely, and it still looks like new. One of my dogs is an 80 pound labrador and the large size fits him well. I ended up ordering a second bed for my other dog because I like it so much. I wish they had some other colors in this model, but the brown color in the picture is true to what I received and it's a nice color.
customer_reviews.author: Madison

customer_reviews.title: Puppy loves this bed!
customer_reviews.text: My chihuahua loves this bed so much I bought a second one and put next to my recliner so he could lay in it next to me while I watch tv. He is happy as a clam in it and I like that you can wash cover.
customer_reviews.author: DANA HULL

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean and sturdy, size perfect
customer_reviews.text: We ordered the medium. Our bull terrier loves it! He enjoys curling up when he sleeps, and also likes to feel protected, so this bed is great for him! He is still a puppy -- 55 lbs. -- so eventually we'll have to upgrade to the large. But for now, it's working well! Easy to clean and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca A.

customer_reviews.title: Dogs dream bed!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to train my dog to sleep on his own bed and he loves it! He likes to sleep in a ball but feel protected but it big enough for him to stretch out, I'm going to have to buy two more for my other dogs because they try to fit in one, now they don't jump on my bed :) so I'm one happy girl!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: If you love your Golden Retriever you must buy him/her this bed!!
customer_reviews.text: We have tried other dog beds - but they were totally ignored by our 85lb Golden - then I saw that this one had the pillow edging/sides and had a hunch. Folks this bed was a hit..a huge hit!! The size is perfect, and the flat padding is like an eggshell mattress cover - so supportive and comfortable- and because of the craters - it BREATHS- so it doesn't build up heat from his body!! He is actually using the pillowed edge as designed---resting his head and snoozing away!! This is, by far, worth every penny you'll spend!!
customer_reviews.author: Nan Abbott

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves this bed!
customer_reviews.text: We have beds in three rooms for our dog and each one is different. This is her favorite. It looks nice and is very soft and comfortable for her. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Skimmer

customer_reviews.title: True love
customer_reviews.text: A friend gave our dachshund one of these (medium size), and he would run and dive into it. I have to drag the bed into our living room, or we never see him...he is almost always in it. When we adopted Oscar's brother, I just had to buy another one, because whichever one did not get into the sleeper first would look so miserable. I also like the way the cover unzips and holds up well in the washing machine.
customer_reviews.author: BobJ

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice bed. Got it for my senior great dane who is down to 93 lbs in her 10th year. She has 2 giant bolster beds but seems to sleep in a tiny ball, so I thought this would be more comforting for her to snuggle up in thru the winter. The large is light and easy to move around compared to her giant bolster beds. Very happy with this one. If you have a large dog, you should definitely spend the $ for the XL though. If she's not in a tight ball, her butt or head is hanging off the edge. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Bxrgrl1013

customer_reviews.title: Impressed!!
customer_reviews.text: My yorki-poos are fighting over their new bed! From the moment I opened the package, they have been in it. Guess I’ll order a second one! I haven’t had to wash it yet, but upon first impressions, it appears to be soft, sturdy, well-constructed, and the removable covers are genius. Zippers and fabric seems to be excellent quality.
customer_reviews.author: Wil

customer_reviews.title: Our cat loves laying in this bed
customer_reviews.text: Our cat loves this bed. She has arthritis, and it supports her body well.
customer_reviews.author: 2hobbits

customer_reviews.title: Best dog bed ever!
customer_reviews.text: This bed is great! My dog, a 10-year old lab mix weighing 80 pounds, laid right down in it and stayed in it the entire evening. His old bed had lost most of the stuffing, so I decided that a 3" thick foam matress in this bed would be perfect for his arthritis. The dog is the judge of quality, and he gives this bed an A+ rating. Order the largest one you can afford; I got the extra large, and he can stretch out completely flat, and his whole body is inside the bed. Show your love for your best friend by getting him the best bed available. Thanks so much.
customer_reviews.author: susieq

customer_reviews.title: Best Dog Bed ever!
customer_reviews.text: Can't say enough good things about this bed from the foam comfort of the bedding to the neckroll ; it's a must. So easy to take off the covers and wash. I bought the largest one and both my dogs sleep on it - unless the cat's on it, then they sleep next it :-) this is the second one I bought to have in a different room since my lab is getting old and needs the comfort
customer_reviews.author: Ell

customer_reviews.title: Not Popular At Our House
customer_reviews.text: We have had dogs and therefore dog beds for as long as I can remember. We've bought many types, some not so great of quality in the past. I had really high hopes for a bed I was spending more on than any other bed before. For an unknown reason though, our dogs didn't care for this bed. For some reason they would rather lay on the floor! It looks nice and seems comfortable, but as humans, I guess what do we know?
customer_reviews.author: MsHotRod

customer_reviews.title: The large is big enough for my 45 pound dog and my 7 year old daughter to lay in comfortably together. This bed is very soft
customer_reviews.text: I bought a large. The large is big enough for my 45 pound dog and my 7 year old daughter to lay in comfortably together. This bed is very soft. It does take up a fair amount of room, but looks nice in the room and is almost the same color as our couches so matches nicely. I do think my children spend more time laying in it than the dog does, so works nice as a child's seat as well.
customer_reviews.author: Knight

customer_reviews.title: Great bed
customer_reviews.text: Just got it today, so far so good! My 9 lb, 13 year old Chihuahua seems to love it. It fits her size well. Good quality also.
customer_reviews.author: A R

customer_reviews.title: Our dogs love these beds
customer_reviews.text: Our dogs love these beds. The removable and washable covers are a must. The cover and bed is very well made. We use these exclusively outdoors on the porch for our ranch dogs and they are holding up reasonably well. There are a few minor tears after one year of use; however, this is to be expected with the heavy use the beds get with large, rough, dirty dogs. I don't expect them to last more than another year, maybe two, of outdoor use. They are a bit pricey to be replaced every 2-3 years, but I do realize we are "heavy users".
customer_reviews.author: Reader

product_meta.title: K&H PET PRODUCTS Ortho Bolster Sleeper Pet Bed
product_meta.description: Size:Small| Style:Retail Box| Color:GraySuperior comfort with the added security of a bolster. This bed sits on top of 3" of medical grade orthopedic foam, while the bolster is filled with premium polyfil made from recycled plastic bottles. The bed is made from soft, upholstery grade velvet and the sleeping surface is covered with super-soft microfleece. This bed is luxury from top to bottom. the cover is removable for easy machine wash and care. Available in 4 sizes and 2 colors.
feature_bullets: Overfilled bolsters surround in comfort, hugging your pet while they sleep
Cover is removable and washable. Superior comfort with the added security of a bolster
Small - Sleeping surface measures 12.5" x 12". Outer Dimensions - Small – 20" L x 16" W x 8" H

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
